main event: A civilian reported observing an oblong disc-shaped object in the sky on 23 September 1957.
interesting points: The object was the size of a basketball and had a reddish-orange color with a dim glow that changed to bright at times., The sighting lasted for approximately 2 minutes., The object moved in a north-easterly direction before disappearing., The report concluded that the object could be an aircraft, balloon, astronomical phenomenon, hoax, or unidentified., No sound was reported during the observation.
witness description: Civilian, specifically a store proprietor in Montezuma.
